THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: With Lok Sabha polls just nine days away in Kerala, activists of an umbrella organisation of various Hindu outfits Saturday staged a dharna here to protest the alleged mass imposition of cases against them in connection with the Sabarimala agitation.Braving the scorching heat, a number of activists, including women, squatted on the road in front of the Secretariat here, and held 'namajapa' protest by chanting Lord Ayyappa hymns near the god's picture.'Sabarimala Karma Samithi', which had spearheaded the agitation against the CPI(M)-led LDF government's decision to implement the Supreme Court September 28 verdict permitting women of all age groups into the shrine, alleged that their members had been implicated in various criminal cases "unlawfully".

A BJP panchayat president in Assam has been shot dead and another party worker critically injured by unidentified gunmen in Cachar district ahead of the three-phase Lok Sabha polls in the State next month, police said on Wednesday.Unidentifed gunmen opened fire at Sukhendu Das, the president of Borkhola Hatichora panchayat, in front of his residence in the village on Tuesday night in which he and another person was grievously injured.The injured person, who was identified as Rinku Senapati, was admitted to the intensive care unit where his condition was stated to be critical.

GUNTUR: Stray clashes between TDP and YSRC supporters continued in some places of Guntur district even on Friday, a day after the polling was held in the State.Tension had prevailed in some villages in Gurajala, Narasaraopet and  Chilakaluripet Assembly constituencies where the TDP and YSRC supporters attacked each other after completion of polling on Thursday.The TDP and YSRC activists clashed at Gurajala, Julakallu, Tungapadu and Irlapadu villages in different constituencies.

In a sensational incident, just a day ahead of Sikkim going to Parliamentary as well as state Assembly polls, an SDF supporter has been allegedly murdered at Tadong near Gangtok.It may be mentioned that Tadong is the constituency of Hamro Sikkim Partys President, Bina Basnett.No arrests or any breakthrough into the alleged murder has been made as of yet.

Reports said Dar was shot at by masked gunmen last evening at Shalipora village of Katrasoo following which he was shifted to a local hospital.Abdul Majeed Dar, who was formerly associated with the Peoples Democratic Party, succumbed at around 11:30 PM at SMHS hospital in Srinagar.SRINAGAR, Apr 4: A panchayat member who was critically injured after being shot at in Kulgam last evening succumbed to his injuries in hospital here.

Kadapa: With less than a week to go for the elections, 40 policemen searched the houses of the Telugu Desam MP Mr C.M.Mild tension built up in Potladurthi village where Mr Rameshs house is located when the MP objected to the search and asked for a warrant.Mr Ramesh immediately called the superintendent of police Mr Abhishek Mohanty, who reportedly replied, Let them do their duty.

Jagan, who is the leader of opposition in Andhra Pradesh, was leaving the lounge to board the flight to Hyderabad when a man approached him to take a selfie and attacked him with a knife that is generally used in cockfights, injuring him on the left shoulder.The police immediately swung into action and took him into custody.The attacker, identified as one J Shrinivas Rao, works as a chef at a restaurant at the same airport, police said.

IMPHAL: A constable suspended for his links with a fugitive militant chief died in police custody on Saturday evening.Recommended By ColombiaThe rebel chief led the banned Kangleipak Communist Party (Mangal/Nando) and had been in jail since 2003 on several charges, including kidnapping and murdering the eight-year-old daughter of former minister Francis Ngajokpa.He was suspended on March 12 on charges that he was associated with militant leader Thokchom Nando.

Political rivals ransacked around 80 houses, looted several shops, and damaged two police vehicles, rendering more than 150 people homeless, a day before the district goes to the polls on Friday.At least 20 people including six policemen were injured in the violence that broke out late in the night on Wednesday and continued till Thursday.Eight people have been arrested.
